title.narrative: Protecting Tanzania’s Environment, Conservation and Tourism (PROTECT)

description.narrative: (Tanzania): <!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}-->The PROTECT activity addresses dynamics in Tanzania that threaten biodiversity conservation and inhibit private sector-led tourism growth. PROTECT is designed to strengthen Tanzanian organizations that are or should be at the forefront of wildlife and conservation policy reform and implementation. These organizations are providing complementary support for wildlife protection and tourism promotion in Tanzania, and fall into three categories: Government of Tanzania; private sector; and non-governmental organizations (NGOs)/industry associations. PROTECT focuses on three main technical areas: 1) policy, research, and advocacy; 2) institutional strengthening; and 3) private sector investment in the wildlife sector. PROTECT will also encourage cooperation among stakeholders working across a range of wildlife anti-poaching and anti-trafficking efforts. FY 2018 funds will enable PROTECT to promote key policy and regulatory reforms to help local conservation and wildlife management organizations become more effective at managing their operations, resulting in stronger biodiversity outcomes. FY 2018 funds will also be used to support counter wildlife trafficking activities. This activity will support the USG priorities as wildlife trafficking in Tanzania is connected to extremists and international criminal organizations, our efforts choke off harmful illicit activity
